title: Ivanka Trump Has Unexpected Hourlong Conversation With Michelle Obama
text:
Ivanka Trump Has Unexpected Hourlong Conversation With Michelle Obama "They have been absolutely great." by Charles Campbell January 18, 2017 at 3:37pm Share on Facebook 543 Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
President-elect Donald Trump’s daughter Ivanka recently talked with first lady Michelle Obama in what was supposed to be a short chat. 
“Ivanka, the other day, spoke to her,” Donald Trump said in an interview that aired Wednesday on Fox News’ Fox & Friends . “The conversation was going to be a quick conversation – it lasted an hour.” 
He said the first lady also met with his wife. “Melania spent time with Michelle and it was great,” Trump said. Advertisement - story continues below 
The incoming president said he plans on thanking President Obama and Michelle during his inauguration speech because of the time and advice they have offered. 
“They have been absolutely great,” he said. Advertisement - story continues below 
Ivanka Trump’s hourlong meeting with Obama further fueled speculation that she will assume some of the duties of the first lady. 
She and her family are moving to Washington full-time, while Melania Trump will be staying behind in New York so son Barron can finish school. 
Ivanka Trump also announced Jan. 11 that she is taking a “formal leave of absence” from the Trump Organization as well as her apparel and accessories company. Advertisement - story continues below Secret Service Talk Of Unprecedented Threat Level On Inauguration Day 
She said she will “take time to settle our three young children into their new home and schools,” but whether she will have a White House role after that is unclear. 
US Weekly reported that the daughter of the president-elect will be his closest adviser, but in an “unofficial capacity.” 
Meanwhile, her husband, Jared Kushner, will officially serve as a senior adviser to the incoming president. 
Ivanka Trump has made it clear that she plans on dedicating a lot of her time to promoting child care initiatives. In December, she reportedly phoned various members of Congress to discuss her father’s plan , which includes, among other things, six weeks of paid leave for new mothers and tax deductions for child care. 
During a New Year’s Day interview on CNN, Rep. Marsha Blackburn, R-Tenn., confirmed to Jake Tapper that she has discussed child care policy with Ivanka Trump. 
“Yes. Yes. I have,” Blackburn said when Tapper asked about it. “And I am delighted to see that we’re looking at options for tax credits, tax incentives, ways for moms and dads to be able to write off this child care cost.” 
Ivanka Trump has said her father is “in a very unique position to do something about this problem.” What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
